definition: to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

pinyin: er4 yang3 hua4 tan4 ge2 li2

sentences.english: Once in the water, it reacts to form carbonic acid.
sentences.chinese: 二氧化碳一旦進入水中，就會發生反應形成碳酸。

sentences.english: Plants take up CO2 and store carbon in their biomasses.
sentences.chinese: 植物吸收二氧化碳並存儲在植物生物量中。

sentences.english: With an excess of carbon dioxide, Venus is hot enough to melt lead.
sentences.chinese: 而二氧化碳過多的話，金星可以熱到能融化鉛的地步。

sentences.english: Carbon dioxide  consists of carbon and oxygen.
sentences.chinese: 二氧化碳是由碳和氧組成的。

sentences.english: Use of ultrasonic energy forces to dissolve CO2 into gas bubbles.
sentences.chinese: 利用超聲波能將二氧化碳分解成氣泡。

sentences.english: In fact, in the daytime, live plants will consume carbon dioxide.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，在白天裏，水中植物也將會耗損二氧化碳。

sentences.english: This basis is the amount of carbon dioxide generated per kilogramme of packaging material.
sentences.chinese: 這依據是二氧化碳的含量每公斤的包裝材料產生的。

sentences.english: A stoma is an opening through which carbon dioxide goes in and oxygen and water vapor escape.
sentences.chinese: 氣孔是二氧化碳進入而氧氣和水蒸氣逸出的開口。

sentences.english: Compound M is a gaseous hydrocarbon and on combustion yields carbon dioxide and water.
sentences.chinese: 化合物M是一種氣態的烴，燃燒時生成二氧化碳和水。

sentences.english: Even the levels of carbon dioxide can be minutely altered.
sentences.chinese: 甚至二氧化碳的濃度每分鐘也有改變。

sentences.english: However hydroxyl has no effect on carbon dioxide.
sentences.chinese: 但是，氫氧化物卻對二氧化碳毫無影響。

sentences.english: and even use of a carbon dioxide laser to shrink the tonsils.
sentences.chinese: 甚至可以用二氧化碳激光器來收縮扁桃體。

sentences.english: Contains calcium for corals and carbon dioxide for zooxanthellae.
sentences.chinese: 含珊瑚所需鈣及蟲黃藻所需二氧化碳。

sentences.english: Instead of using it to grow, the bacteria breatheit out as carbon dioxide.
sentences.chinese: 細菌難以利用其生長，轉而將其以二氧化碳形式呼出。

sentences.english: At best it can only sequester 90 percent of the carbon emitted.
sentences.chinese: 它最多隻能捕獲90%的二氧化碳排放量。

sentences.english: Goes up the stack as CO2.
